Skip clinics. Get an Endocrinologist consultation online.

If you struggle with hormone and thyroid issues, diabetes, high cholesterol or PCOS, an endocrinologist can help — but getting an appointment can take months.

Get an endocrinology consultation on Maple in 24 hours or less — from your phone, tablet or computer.

Available in British Columbia, Nunavut, Ontario, Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador. Coming soon to other provinces.

Get started now

Seeing an endocrinologist online on Maple is easy.

First, choose a topic to discuss

No appointment necessary. Simply enter your symptoms and attach any relevant files or images. Your request will be securely sent to a Canadian-licensed endocrinologist and you’ll hear back in 24 hours or less.

Consultations are $195 and include the applicable diagnosis, and any necessary treatment plans or prescriptions.

Get started

Next, you’ll be matched with an endocrinologist

The matching process typically takes several hours — a response is guaranteed in no more than 24 hours.

The endocrinologist will review your request, and work with you to reach a diagnosis and treatment plan. If the specialist can’t help you on Maple, you will not be charged for your consultation.

 

Get started

Start your online endocrinologist visit

The endocrinologist will review your case with you, and provide you with a diagnosis and treatment plan as needed, including any necessary prescriptions — with the exception of controlled medications such as narcotics.

Once you accept a prescription, you’ll have the option to pick it up from any pharmacy or we’ll deliver it right to your door at no additional cost.

The endocrinologist may also recommend and order any necessary lab work and tests right on Maple.

Get started

Frequently Asked Questions

What is an endocrinologist?

An endocrinologist is a licensed doctor who specializes in the treatment of many hormone related conditions such as thyroid issues, diabetes and select fertility concerns.

To find out if an endocrinologist can help you, simply submit a request and you’ll hear back in 24 hours or less. If your request is not suitable for online diagnosis and treatment, the endocrinologist will let you know, and you won’t be charged.

What can an online endocrinologist treat?

All endocrinologists on Maple are highly experienced. They are accredited by the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons, and they practice right here in Canada. Endocrinologists can help treat:

  • Diabetes
  • Thyroid problems
  • Adrenal gland problems
  • Pituitary gland problems
  • PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome)/menstrual problems
  • Low testosterone
  • Bone/osteoporosis/calcium problems
  • High lipids/cholesterol

Kindly note that if our endocrinologists are not able to help you on Maple, they’ll let you know ahead of time and you will not be charged for the consultation fee.

Do I need a referral for the endocrinologist?

No. Unlike an in-person visit, you don’t need a referral to see an endocrinologist on Maple.

If your request is not suitable for online diagnosis and treatment, the endocrinologist will let you know, and you won’t be charged.

Does the endocrinologist check my hormone levels?

If you’ve recently had lab work or tests done, the endocrinologist can certainly review and discuss the results with you. However, the endocrinologist can also order lab work for you right on Maple depending on your needs.

To find out if an endocrinologist can help you, simply submit a request and you’ll hear back in 24 hours or less. If your request is not suitable for online diagnosis and treatment, the endocrinologist will let you know, and you won’t be charged.

Getting an endocrinologist appointment can take months. Skip the wait.

Maple revolves around your needs and schedule. Connect with an endocrinologist online in 24 hours or less.
